Siasat Pajak Murah Dealer Mobil Mewah
04 Nov 2019, 03:00 by Andita Rahma, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi terus menyoroti PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga, dealer resmi mobil merek Jaguar, Land Rover, dan Bentley sejak komisarisnya, Darwin Maspolm, diduga menyuap empat pegawai Direktorat Jenderal Pajak.
Keempat pegawai itu diduga disuap sebesar Rp 1,8 miliar untuk menyulap pembukuan tahun 2015 dan 2016 agar mendapatkan restitusi pajak dari pemerintah. Kini empat pegawai itu kini sudah ditahan oleh KPK sejak Oktober 2019.
PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga merupakan dealer resmi merek mobil Jaguar, Land Rover, dan Bentley sejak 2017. Perusahaan itu melanjutkan bisnis penjualan mobil dan ruang pamer dari PT Grandauto Dinamika, di mana Grandauto tercatat sebagai agen tunggal pemegang merek tiga mobil itu sejak awal 2000. Kedua perusahaan itu disebut berada di bawah satu induk, yakni Samling Group yang berpusat di Malaysia.
Seiring dengan penyidikan yang dilakukan KPK, ditemukan fakta lain bahwa kedua perusahaan itu diduga merekayasa faktur impor mobil sejak 2000-an. Seorang penegak hukum menyebut PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga dan PT Grandauto Dinamika memanipulasi faktur impor dengan tujuan mengurangi harga mobil hingga setengahnya.
"Dengan mengurangi harga impor, pajak yang harus dibayarkan akan jauh berkurang," ujar penegak hukum itu, sebagaimana dilansir Majalah tempo edisi 4 November 2019.
Seperti diketahui, Jaguar, Land Rover, dan Bentley memang tergolong barang mewah karena harga jualnya yang mencapai Rp 4,2 miliar. Atas kategori itulah, Bea dan Cukai menerapkan pajak dengan persentasi tinggi terhadap ketiga merek mobil tersebut.
PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga pun diduga melibatkan banyak pihak dalam merekayasa faktur. Mereka mengimpor ketiga mobil itu melalui satu perusahaan importir Singapura, di mana perusahaan ini juga diduga membuat tiga faktur dengan nilai uang berbeda.
KPK kini mengaku sudah mengantongi setumpuk dokumen dugaan rekayasa perhitungan pajak PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga. Lembaga antirasuah itu juga terus membuka komunikasi dengan penyelidik Direktorat Jenderal Pajak dalam menangani kasus ini.
Sementara itu, Pengacara PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga, Andy Kelana, menyangkal segala tuduhan KPK bahwa perusahaan yang perkaranya ia tangani mencurangi faktur pembelian untuk mengakali pajak.
"PT Wahana hanya menyediakan showroom. Seharusnya importir yang paling mengetahui soal invoice tersebut (PT Globalindo Permata tercatat sebagai pengimpor tersebut)," ujar Andy. Baca berita selengkapnya di Majalah Tempo "Skandal Pajak Murah Mobil Mewah".

ANDITA RAHMA | MAJALAH TEMPO

Cheap Tax Carrier Strategies for Luxury Car Dealers
Nov. 04 2019, 03:00 by Andita Rahma, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Corruption Eradication Commission continues to highlight PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga, the official dealer of Jaguar, Land Rover and Bentley brands since its commissioner, Darwin Maspolm, allegedly bribed four employees of the Directorate General of Taxes.
The four employees were allegedly bribed in the amount of Rp 1.8 billion to juggle accounting in 2015 and 2016 in order to get tax refunds from the government. Now the four employees have now been detained by the KPK since October 2019.
PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga is the official dealer of Jaguar, Land Rover, and Bentley car brands since 2017. The company has continued the car and showroom sales business of PT Grandauto Dinamika, where Grandauto has been listed as the sole agent for the brands of three cars since early 2000. Second the company is said to be under one parent, namely Samling Group, based in Malaysia.
Along with investigations conducted by the KPK, other facts were discovered that the two companies allegedly fabricated car import invoices since the 2000s. A law enforcer said PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga and PT Grandauto Dinamika manipulated import invoices with the aim of reducing car prices by half.
"By reducing the import price, the tax that must be paid will be far reduced," said the law enforcer, as reported by the 4 November 2019 edition of the magazine.
As is known, Jaguar, Land Rover, and Bentley are indeed classified as luxury goods because the selling price reaches Rp 4.2 billion. For this category, Customs and Excise imposed high percentages of taxes on the three car brands.
PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga is also suspected of involving many parties in fabricating invoices. They imported the three cars through a Singapore importing company, where the company was also suspected of making three invoices with different money values.
The KPK now claims to have pocketed a stack of alleged documents designed by PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga. The interfaith agency also continued to open communications with the Directorate General of Tax investigators in handling this case.
Meanwhile, Attorney of PT Wahana Auto Ekamarga, Andy Kelana, denied all the KPK's allegations that the company whose case he handled cheated the purchase invoice to outsmart taxes.
"PT Wahana only provides a showroom. Importers should know the most about the invoice (PT Globalindo Permata is listed as the importer)," Andy said. Read the full story in Tempo Magazine "Cheap Luxury Car Tax Scandal".

ANDITA RAHMA | TEMPO MAGAZINE
